intro: Hornemannia floccosa, commonly known as the woolly hornemannia, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native habitat.
